addUpdatable() addUpdatablegamerunner.Dispatcher gamerunner.DispatcheraddUpdatable
void gamerunner.Dispatcher.addUpdatable (IUpdatable updatable)[inline]
Adds an updatable object to the collection of updatables.
Parameters
updatable
The updatable object to be added.
This method allows for the registration of objects that implement the IUpdatable interface. The added updatable can then be updated in a batch process, typically during a game loop or a similar update cycle. This is useful for managing multiple objects that require periodic updates, such as animations, game entities, or other dynamic components. The method modifies the internal collection of updatables by adding the provided object to it. Here is the caller graph for this function:
Awake() Awakegamerunner.Dispatcher gamerunner.DispatcherAwake
void gamerunner.Dispatcher.Awake ( )[inline], [private]
Initializes the component when it is first loaded.
This method is called when the script instance is being loaded. It initializes the private field _updatables to a new instance of a list that implements the IUpdatable interface. This setup is crucial for managing objects that require periodic updates during the game loop. The Awake method is typically used for initialization tasks that need to be completed before any other methods are called.
Update() Updategamerunner.Dispatcher gamerunner.DispatcherUpdate
void gamerunner.Dispatcher.Update ( )[inline], [private]
Updates all updatable entities in the collection.
This method iterates through a collection of updatable entities stored in the private field _updatables . For each entity, it calls the Update method, allowing each entity to perform its own update logic. This is typically used in game loops or similar scenarios where multiple entities need to be updated on each frame or tick. The method does not return any value and does not throw exceptions.
